#summary Coding style guidelines

== General Style Guidelines for Concise/Compact coding ==
  * Rule: *Use curly braces, and try to span less lines*.
  * Ex1: indentation is 4-char width.
  * Ex2: operators
    * Good: {{{ a = b; a == b; a < b; a > b; ++a; --b;}}}
    * OKay: {{{ a=b; a==b; a<b; a>b; ++ a; -- b;}}}
    * Bad: {{{ a= b; a ==b; a< b; a >b; }}}
  * Ex3: curly braces
    * In a single line: {{{ { ... } }}}
    * In multiple lines (open and close at the same column):
      {{{
      {
         ...
      }
      }}}
  * Ex4: Reference/pointer placement: left align (right align is okay).
    * Good: {{{ int& a = x; }}},  {{{ int* p = x; }}}
    * Bad: {{{ int & a = x; }}},  {{{ int * p = x; }}}
  * Ex5: brackets (put as closely as possible).
    * Good: {{{ (a == b) }}}
    * Okay: {{{ ( a == b ) }}}
    * Bad:  {{{ (a == b ) }}}
  * Ex6: _if_ statement with tiny body.
    * Good: {{{ if (x == y) { ++x; } }}}
    * Okay: {{{ if (x == y) ++x; }}}
    * Bad:  
      {{{ 
      if (x == y) 
        ++x;
      }}}
  * Ex7: _if-else_ statement with tiny body.
    * Good: 
      {{{
      if (x == y) { print(x); ++x; }
      else        { print(y); --y; }
      }}}
    * Or ...
     {{{
      x == y ? print(x++) : print(y--);
     }}}
  * Ex8: use "_? :_" to simplify code.
    * Good: 
    {{{ 
    x == y ? ++x : --y; 
    }}}
    * Okay:
    {{{
    if (x == y) { ++x; }
    else        { --y; }
    }}}
